action: I want to accurately register the inbound receipt of purchased products into the inventory system
reason: To prevent inconsistencies in inventory counts and ensure sales and shipping operations are performed correctly
acceptance_criteria: Inbound processing is only executable by authenticated users.
Only roles with inbound registration authority can perform operations.
The target Product ID for inbound receipt is mandatory.
Registration fails if a non-existent Product ID is specified.
Product master data must be pre-registered.
Inbound quantity can only be entered as an integer.
Inbound quantity must be 1 or greater.
Validation errors occur if non-numeric values are entered.
The inbound date and time are automatically recorded using the server time.
The inbound representative ID is saved in the logs.
Conflicts in simultaneous inbound registration for the same product are detected.
Due to optimistic locking, one operation fails when there is a conflict in inventory count updates.
Upon successful inbound registration, the inventory quantity is incremented and updated.
Inventory updates are executed within a transaction.
Rollback is performed if the update fails.
History is saved in the inbound history table.
History includes Product ID, quantity, representative, and timestamp.
Inbound reason (Purchase, Return, Adjustment, etc.) can be selected.
Reasons are selected from a predefined master list.
The free-text reason input field is limited to 500 characters.
Input values are sanitized (Anti-XSS).
DB access uses parameterized queries (Anti-SQL Injection).
The same validation applies to registration via API.
Unauthorized access attempts return a 403 Forbidden error.
Internal DB information is not included in the API response.
An inventory change notification event is issued upon successful inbound receipt.
Notification processing is handled via an asynchronous queue.
Inbound logs are saved as audit logs.
Logs are stored in tamper-evident storage.
Supports batch inbound processing via CSV.
Validation is performed for each row during CSV import.
Error rows are skipped and logged.
Batch inbound processing is transaction-controllable.
Rate limiting is applied to the API.
Communication is conducted via HTTPS.
The API is REST-compliant.
API versioning is managed.
Target response time is within 300ms.
User-facing messages and internal logs are separated upon operation failure.
Alert notifications are possible when the inventory count exceeds a threshold.
